content.description: Nice slab. Stand start climb up the water cuts to easy jug top out. Very easy climb down to the right of top out
content.protection: One pad and possibly spotter depending on ball size
content.location: Walk straight out from every 7/pagan on Sunday to find it.

content.description: Sit start. Right hand on crimp, left hand on sidel pull/under cling. Right hand dyno up to sloper. Left hand up then top out.
content.protection: Pad, spotter to push you away from a back breaker.
content.location: Facing fight or flight, around the left side of the boulder. Left of a tree.

content.description: Sit start facing left matched on separated rock turning back right onto the main rock for a nice right hand crimp. Then Straight up and out.
content.protection: Two pads and spotter but one pad/spotter WILL work.
content.location: Facing Creepy Crawlers turn around and walk around the boulder to your left. It's in a hole on the backside with a tree on the right side.

content.description: Fun problem with optional body swing. Sit start on matched pinch to jugs to slopers. Mainly left arm until the reach for the first right sloper.
content.location: Directly behind Tickle the Trickle. Walk out from every 7/pagan on Sunday.

content.description: Star on the low right side of the boulder and use good hands as you traverse left for a few moves. The crux move is a little past halfway through the traverse and you move to a pinch/match hold and make a somewhat desperate move to a small edge. After that, the topout is straightforward and easy.
content.protection: At least one pad, there is a backbreaker rock in the fall zone throughout the whole problem.
content.location: Directly behind Creepy Crawlers 5.8 on an overhanging boulder

content.description: Sit start left crimp/right high sloper. Work your way out to the end and then straight up. Be mindful of sharp hold when breaking over to go for top out.
content.location: In the same general area as the rest. Closest to pitfall.

content.description: Shady with poison ivy lots of places. Best to visit in winter. No set trail through this area yet.
